title: San Francisco/Golden Gate
name: Fort Point National Historic Site
hours: Video orientations, guided tours, self-guiding materials, exhibits, and publication sales are offered Th-M 10AM-5PM
content: From its vantage point overlooking the spectacular Golden Gate, Fort Point protected San Francisco harbor from Confederate and foreign attack during and after the U.S. Civil War. Its beautifully arched casemates display the art of the master brick masons of the Civil War period.  It is best approached from the Marina District along the water through the kites and bay-views of the connected Crissy Field Park.
